name: The Berkeley

reviews.text: Stayed here on business in early September 2010 for three nights. My company's rate got me a small, traditionally decorated and unrenovated room on the 6th floor. The wallpaper and drapes had an ornate, dark green fox hunting motif - I kid you not. That was certainly different. The room was clean and comfortable, and had the all-important flat screen HDTV. The bathroom was a white-marble wonder, beautifully lit and even had a bidet. The room, while elegant in that odd, British traditional way, could use updating.
reviews.title: Fox hunt wallpaper!

reviews.text: The public areas of the hotel are quite elegant and the eastern European women at the front desk are uber-efficient and go out of their way to welcome guests and let them know how to make full use of this first-class hotel. This year I will try Claridge's since we have a good rate there, too, but if had not been available I would be glad to come back to this hotel. Great location near the Knightsbridge tube station, incidentally, but area is overrun with tourists during the day and on the weekends.
reviews.title: There must be TWO Berkeleys!!!

reviews.text: I've been shocked by the standard of some hotels that charge stupid money to stay overnight yet they offer average food and facilities, there is nothing average about The Berkeley they look after you properly, feed you well and keep you safe and secure at all times. I cannot think of another hotel that I bother to drop into whenever I come to London, it's so hard to drive past it on Knightsbridge and not think I could be in the Caramel Room enjoying a quenching and antioxidant inducing Virgin Caipirinha right now why even think about driving on by.
reviews.title: A place where memories are made!!Wonderful Wonderful Hotel!!

reviews.text: The Berkeley is an elegant oasis in London, the land of underwhelming hotels. The service is attentive, without being cloying. Everything runs like clockwork and a web based, pre-check-in allows for customized requests, including type of pillow. Junior suites are spacious, in room breakfast a delight. As an added bonus both restaurants at the property -- Kaufmann's and Marcus Wareing-- are superb. The Blue Bar was too much of a scene for us -- with some strange table reservation scheme on the part of the hostess, which we found off putting. That said, we'd still plan to return on our next visit to London.
reviews.title: Elegant and discerning

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here on a business trip - was ideal for us as I could hit Knightsbridge whillst he was busy. Nice room with large marble bathroom with shower in the bath. Cocktails at the Blue Bar and breakfast at the Caramel Room both lovely. Good service for London. Hotel feels intimate. The roof top pool is small but provides a nice chill area and the steam room and sauna convenient. Hotel has a well equipped gym. Hotel is worth the price. I would recommend this hotel for its location and service.
reviews.title: Nice location and superb service

reviews.text: We stayed at the Berkeley as we were attending a friend's birthday at the hotel. Things didn't start well when I arrived and had to drag my suitcase up the stairs and through the revolving door on my own as the doormen were busy. Reception was efficient and friendly but the next disappointment was the room. We were told that we had been upgraded but the room was unremarkable and the bathroom needed some attention - grouting needed replacing as did the odd floor tile. The bed was very comfortable though and I did sleep very well.
reviews.title: I Expect More

reviews.text: Breakfast in the morning was the next disappointment. I asked for freshly squeesed orange juice and was given juice that was obviously out of a carton. We also had to wait an unreasonably long time to be served.
reviews.title: A memorable experience

reviews.text: Beautiful comfortable room with a really comfy bed and top quality bedding which was changed each day... along with two changes of towels per day!. Nice large marble bathroom with loads of hot water and plenty of toiletries topped up twice a day too.
reviews.title: Better than perfect!

reviews.text: The staff are very nice ,friendly and courteous. The only downside was the prices of drinks in the mini bar ie £4 for a small bottle of water... although a bottle of water each was supplied in the evening with the turning down service. The massage I had was superb too!!!
reviews.title: The Best Afternoon Tea in the World

reviews.text: This hotel is a really good mix of old and new the young staff in the restaurants and Blue Bar gives the Berkeley a funky vibe, while the conciërge etc. gives you that warm English welcome. Food is more than very good, breakfast is very nice way to start your day in London. Location, yes it's all about location. We walked everything, stayed in many hotels in London but this is THE best! We will leave tomorrow but don't wanna think about it while enjoyning this heavenly bed and stay for another 24 hours in this wonderful hotel, good job Berkeley! Be back this year, never wanna be in another hotel while in London.
reviews.title: The best service in London

reviews.text: This past week I did not have the good fortune to stay at this remarkable hotel, although we did experience their "Prêt-à-Portea" afternoon tea. I don' t think there is any hotel in London who can top their stylish, chic and very different concept of afternoon tea. The range of teas is amazing, all served on the most beautiful and exquisite Paul Smith crockery. The service is outstanding, friendly, understated and refined. The afternoon tea food items items are out of this world in creativity and colour and simply delicious. What a fresh way of doing an afternoon tea. I would highly recommend this experience to anyone wanting to experience something different and elegant in London. The only problem is that you may not want to leave.
reviews.title: High price for a non renovated hotel !
